name: Welburn Lodge

reviews.title: Great hospitality
reviews.text: My wife and I have just spent a great weekend at Welburn Lodge that we would recommend highly to all our friends and family!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the B&B on tripadvisor,and after a quick glance at the website,booked the accomadation very quickly and easily over the net!
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stella & Steve we're perfect hosts,made us feel very comfortable and at home straight away.
reviews.title: Dont Go Anywhere Else!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Abbey Room and was very pleased,if the other rooms are on par,then no one will be disappointed.Breakfast was excellent also!
reviews.title: Welburn Lodge Nr York
Top Class, Outstanding B & B
reviews.text: Following the outstanding reviews, we could not resist experiencing this place for ourselves. I can honestly report that we have never experienced such fantastic hospitality as we did from Welburn Lodge’s most charming hosts – Steve & Stella. As a travel professional that has travelled the world for business, finding a personal choice is often a challenge. However, from the moment we arrived, it was like home from home - and every detail is a delight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Minster Room that was spotless and featured the touches normally expected in a top class hotel. The style and quality of the furnishings combined with top quality bedding and a superb shower far exceeded expectations. The breakfast in the cosy dining room was faultless and only enhanced by Steve’s great humour and the occasional appearance by the charming chef Stella. All other guests were equally thrilled by this find.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have little experience of B & B’s but I suspect Welburn Lodge is now the benchmark! Steve & Stella have thought of every detail and their enthusiasm is unparrelled. It seems they have achieved great accolades and their 4 star tourist board rating in a short space of time and we can see why. We will return again and again – but I suspect this will be a tough place to get into as word spreads.
reviews.title: The Best!

likes.liked: — The luxury of the room and house!
likes.disliked: — Nothing to comment everything was brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A wonderful B & B – superbly located for York and the key sights of North Yorkshire. We look forward to our next visit. Highly recommended – if only to meet the terrific Steve & Stella!
reviews.title: A Real Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed a 1 night stay here after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. The hosts met us as we got out of our car, and from that moment on could not do enough for us. After showing us our room they recommended places worth a visit and even offered to book a table at the local pub for that evening for us (The pub food was also excellent ). We stayed in the Abbey room which had a fantastic double shower - very powerful and as much hot water as you wanted. A selection of DVD's are available for you to watch in your room as well. Breakfast was excellent - lots of choice and refill after refill of coffee/orange juice. Overall a fantastic stay which was made even more memorable by the hosts who make this place a home from home.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night in Welburn Lodge and wish we could have spent longer. We had to continue our journey to Northumberland to see relatives the following day therefore reluctantly had to leave. We stayed in the Albany Room and it was perfect for us. It was comfortable, stylish and scrupulously clean. Stella and Steve have refurbished and decorated this beautiful lodge with love and attention to detail therefore it feels very homely and welcoming. They are a very friendly and helpful couple and even offered to pick us up from the local pub during the evening if it was raining. They also lent us torches as we opted to walk to and from the pub. The English breakfast was the best we have had in a hotel, the produce was farmed locally and was good quality. Stella and Steve do not cut corners, even the toiletries were nice, not the usual "washing up liquid" shampoo and shower gel found in some hotels. We will definitely go back there and will recommend Welburn Lodge to our friends and family.
reviews.title: Hard to find better than this

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While perusing through the web looking for a place to stay in Yorkshire I knew I had found the place when I came across Welburn Lodge. From their inviting website to the quick response from Steve and Stella when I sent them my initial e-mail requesting information on their location, etc. I knew this was the place for us. Even before I had confirmed a room with them, they were already acting as my personal concierge, providing me with various websites and detailed options on the best ways to get to Yorkshire from our prior stop in Madrid.
reviews.title: Posh Porridge and Warm Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Upon arrival, their hospitality could not have been warmer. They made us feel like we were staying with friends rather than at a B and B. Our room was comfortable and impeccably clean and was exactly as represented on their website. Steve was able to set up an internet connection in our room, and even had the Mexican flag flying to welcome my husband. They were full of suggestions of things to do and great places to eat and provided detailed maps of how to get where we wanted to go. They even offered to shuttle us to their local pub and back for dinner.
reviews.title: Wonderful attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stella's breakfasts are amazing, and are made to order. She will fix exactly the amount you want. They make so much food available that you really don't need to eat lunch. Her posh porridge is her own invention and is one of the most delicious things I have ever had for breakfast.
reviews.title: Welburn Lodge Re-Visited

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only glitch was that our DVD player did not work (it is something new they are putting in the rooms) but Steve immediately replaced it the following day with one that did work and offered a heartfelt apology.
reviews.title: A Home From Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Conveniently located just off the A64 between York and Scarborough, North Yorkshire, Welburn Lodge is an absolutely superb B&B. Stella and Steve made my parents, wife and I most welcome and could not have done anymore to make our two night stay a most memorable experience.
reviews.title: A Yorkshire Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This lovely restored victorian house is very well presented with tastefully decorated rooms and excellent facilities. The hearty breakfast, including locally sourced Yorkshire fayre, was excellent and set us up for the day. We didn't need any lunch!
reviews.title: The best

likes.liked: — Everything - all as declared on web site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: A top notch B&B situated right at the heart of many local attractions and sites of interest including the magnificent Castle Howard estate right on the door step. Stella and Steve were helpful poviding local knowledge and the loan of a map to sign post the way on a lovely woodland walk to an atmospheric ruined priory.
reviews.title: Wonderful People!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a fantastic base to explore the North Yorkshire countryside, coast and places of local interest I recommend you choose Welburn Lodge. You will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dave Barr
reviews.title: Fabulus Gothic Retreat

likes.liked: — Immaculate romantic room with modern bathroom within walking distance of Castle Howard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed with Stella & Steve for 2 nights and had a fantastic time! I get very nervous staying in strange places but I needn't have worried, Stella & Steve are truly a fantastic couple, from the moment we arrived they made us feel right at home. The rooms were immaculate and well looked after and the breakfast was wicked and there was plenty of it, mmm!
reviews.title: Home from home. Stay here, it's great!!

likes.disliked: — Would've liked wooden floors rather than carpet in the bedrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It takes about 25mins to get the bus into central York but the bus stop is right out the front of the B&B and they run up until midnight on a Friday and Saturday which was perfect for us. Also there is a picture perfect village up the road that has a great traditional pub that sells cheap yet fantastic pub grub, the pub will even give you a lift back to the B&B after!!
reviews.title: Stella and Steve and their wonderful creation!
Wonderful time
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed in the minster room at welburn lodge, as soon as we arrived we knew we had made the right decision for the perfect getaway.

reviews.title: Yorkshire adventure
reviews.text: We were warmly welcomed, showed to our gorgeous room filled with all the right ingredients to make a great stay and a luxurious bathroom which is to die for. Breakfast in the morning was thoroughly enjoyable and to taste, very pleasent to come down to with relaxing music to help you wake and a wonderfully light captured room. The outer surroundings such as the well crafted garden and design of the b&b where flawless and wonderful to sit and relax in. I really can't praise this 6 star place anymore then it deserves!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will be bk nxt year without a doubt. Thanks again. xx
reviews.title: Comfortable and caring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Welburn Lodge for 2 nights only but wished it was more. We were warmly welcomed by Stella and Steve who were so helpful really lovely people. Their B&B was just gorgeous and although we were approx 15- 20mins away from York it was not a problem. Although we had a car we used the local Coastliner bus service to get into York, a lovely ride. Would highly recommend this beautiful place and hope to return.
reviews.title: Wonderful Welburn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The little touches to make us feel welcome were terrific, they had the Aussie flag flying and and a little Koala hanging off the chandelier. Try Stella's Posh Porridge great way to start the day and Steve is sure to put a smile on your face, great sense of humour.
reviews.title: Romantic Haven in North Yorkshire

likes.liked: — Room decor, attention to detail, warm welcome
likes.disliked: — Right next to busy dual carriageway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Thanks Stella and Steve!
reviews.title: loved the black pudding

likes.liked: — Charming hosts. Spotlessly clean. Sumptuous breakfast.
likes.disliked: — abolutely NOTHING to complain or criticise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really impressed with everything from the warm and friendly welcome to the many thoughtful touches in the rooms and in helping us to plan our stay. First class! Room gorgeous, breakfast lovely, secluded garden to sit in, Will be back!
reviews.title: A North Yorkshire country haven

likes.liked: — Spotlessly clean facilities and interesting decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rosey and John Scarborough
reviews.title: An excellent establishment

description: Situated close to Castle Howard and only 13 miles from the City of York Welburn Lodge is in an enviable location for most of the major visitor attractions of North Yorkshire. Welburn Lodge is a grade II listed property and a fine example of gothic revival architecture. Unlike most B&B's the guest and owners accommodation are completely separate including the enchanting guest garden. Beautifully furnished rooms have individual styles with modern and spacious ensuite facilities.
